title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Melville Castle, the seat of Viscount Melville, is one mile from Lasswade, and six from Edinburgh. The building was erected by the celebrated Harry Dundas, first Viscount Melville.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Morning spent in making up proofs and copy. Set out for Melville Castle with Jane, who goes on to her mother at Edinburgh.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Wrote letters to Lord Melville, etc, and agreed to act under the Commission. Settled to be at Melville Castle, Saturday 24th. I fear this will interfere consumedly with business.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Dined at Melville Castle, whither I went through a snow-storm. I was glad to find myself once more in a place connected with many happy days.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Never stirred abroad the whole day, but was made happy after dinner by the return of Charles and Surtees full of their Irish jaunt, and happy as young men are with the change of scene. To-morrow I must go to Melville Castle. I wonder what I can do or say about these
